page.title: 20OTHER FARMS,DUNTISBOURNE
page.content:
There are fewer farms today than 100 years ago.Some have merged and are run as one unit:Cotswold and Rectory Farms,Voxhills and Dartley Farms. Others have sold off land and their farmhouses are purely residential, such as Nutbeam and Church farms. The Cotswold Hills have traditionally been seen as sheep rearing areas but today the farmers here are concentrating on other animals and crops.Variety and flexibility are the keywords at the moment in farming.
CREDITS THE DOMESDAY SURVEY IN THE DUNTISBOURNE AREA WAS CARRIED OUT IN THE SUMMER OF 1985 BY TWO 4TH YEAR CITIZENSHIP GROUPS AT HUCCLECOTE SECONDARY SCHOOL UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF I.BRIDGE,S.TINCELLO AND M.WRIGHT.
